longTitle.p: COUNCIL DECISION (CFSP) 2020/251of 25 February 2020amending Decision (CFSP) 2018/905 extending the mandate of the European Union Special Representative for the Horn of Africa

formula.name: actingEntity
formula.p: THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION,

citation.p: Having regard to the Treaty on European Union, and in particular Article 33 and Article 31(2) thereof,
Having regard to the proposal from the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy,

recital.p:
On 8 December 2011, the Council adopted Decision 2011/819/CFSP
Council Decision 2011/819/CFSP of 8 December 2011 appointing the European Union Special Representative for the Horn of Africa (OJ L 327, 9.12.2011, p. 62). appointing Mr Alexander RONDOS as the European Union Special Representative (EUSR) for the Horn of Africa.

On 25 June 2018, the Council adopted Decision (CFSP) 2018/905
Council Decision (CFSP) 2018/905 of 25 June 2018 extending the mandate of the European Union Special Representative for the Horn of Africa (OJ L 161, 26.6.2018, p. 16). extending the mandate of the EUSR for the Horn of Africa. The EUSR's mandate is to expire on 29 February 2020.

The mandate of the EUSR for the Horn of Africa should be extended for a further period of six months and a new financial reference amount for the period from 1 March 2020 to 31 August 2020 should be established.

The EUSR for the Horn of Africa will implement the mandate in the context of a situation which may deteriorate and could impede the achievement of the objectives of the Union's external action as set out in Article 21 of the Treaty,

content.p: In Article 1, paragraph 1 is replaced by the following:

The mandate of Mr Alexander RONDOS as the European Union Special Representative (EUSR) for the Horn of Africa is extended until 31 August 2020. The Council may decide that the mandate of the EUSR be terminated earlier, based on an assessment by the Political and Security Committee (PSC) and a proposal from the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy (HR).'.
In Article 5(1), the following subparagraph is added:
'The financial reference amount intended to cover the expenditure related to the EUSR's mandate for the period from 1 March 2020 to 31 August 2020 shall be EUR 1400000.'.
In Article 14, the following subparagraph is added:
'The final comprehensive mandate implementation report of the EUSR shall be presented by 15 June 2020.'.
This Decision shall enter into force on the date of its adoption. It shall apply from 1 March 2020.
